Body: NEW YORK Stocks fell on Friday as a weak jobs report dashed optimism that the economy was emerging from a soft patch, leaving investors to hope earnings season would revive an appetite for buying. |Â ,NEW YORK Wall Street heads into earnings season next week playing a typical game: Worrying about results a lot, and then rallying on pleasant surprises., NEW YORK, July 8 Wall Street heads intoearnings season next week playing a typical game: Worryingabout results a lot, and then rallying on pleasant surprises., * Schmidt to testify about online competition in September, * Dow off 0.5 pct, S&P down 0.7 pct, Nasdaq off 0.5 pct* For up-to-the-minute market news see [STXNEWS/US] (Updates to close),WASHINGTON Google Inc Chairman Eric Schmidt will testify at a September hearing before the Senate Judiciary Committee's Antitrust Subcommittee, Senator Mike Lee said on Friday., WASHINGTON, July 8 Google Inc  ChairmanEric Schmidt will testify at a September hearing before theSenate Judiciary Committee's Antitrust Subcommittee, SenatorMike Lee said on Friday., * Google slumps on downgrade, one of Nasdaq's top drags,BANGALORE Shares of Local.com Corp  surged 24 percent to a 10-week high on Friday, a day after the U.S. search provider signed an agreement with Google Inc  for advertising and search services., * Investors to focus on upcoming earnings for direction

Title: Twitter security lags some other sites: experts,Twitter security lags some other sites -experts,RIM says adds 1 million EMEA subscribers in 3 weeks,EBay buys Zong as mobile payments gain traction,Facebook launches video chat with Skype,UPDATE 5-Samsung Q2 falls as weak LCDs overshadow mobiles,LG sees H2 smartphone sales up 40 pct, cuts 2011 handset targets,Hulu owners seeking best sale value, says Disney's Iger
Body: BOSTON/NEW YORK The fast-growing microblogging site Twitter has fallen behind some other Internet services in introducing tools to help secure the accounts of users, security experts say.,   * Needs to boost technology to verify passwords -experts,TORONTO BlackBerry maker Research In Motion said on Thursday it has added more than one million subscribers in Europe, the Middle East and Africa in less than three weeks.,NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO EBay Inc said on Thursday it agreed to buy cellphone payments provider Zong for about $240 million in cash to help its PayPal unit push further into mobile commerce.,PALO ALTO, California Facebook will add Skype video chat to its pages, aiming to spice up the appeal of the world's No. 1 Internet social networking service while fending off increased competition from Google. |Â , * Estimates Q2 sales at 39 trln won vs 40 trln won consensus, SEOUL, July 7 LG Electronics Inc , the world's No.3handset maker, expected its smartphone sales to rise by around 40 percent in thesecond half to 14 million units from the previous half, as it introduced Optimus3D on Thursday in South Korea in its latest push to turn around the loss-makinghandset business., SUN VALLEY, Idaho, July 6 Hulu's current jointowners are seeking the highest possible value in a sale ratherthan focusing on who a new owner might be, Walt Disney Co Chief Executive Bob Iger said on Wednesday.

Body: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc will launch a tablet computer this year to extend its position as the world's largest Internet retailer, expand in mobile commerce and sell more digital goods, according to analysts and investors., * Tablet to be released by October, to run on Android -WSJ, WASHINGTON, July 13 Republican Senator JohnMcCain called on Wednesday for the creation of a bipartisanpanel to draft long-sought legislation to combat data breachesand espionage aimed at U.S. companies and defense networks.,SAN FRANCISCO Twitter is courting bigtime advertisers and will soon allow them to tailor, automate and publish ads in bulk directly onto the Internet microblogging service, according to two people with knowledge of the matter., SAN FRANCISCO, July 13 Twitter is courtingbigtime advertisers and will soon allow them to tailor,automate and publish ads in bulk directly onto the Internetmicroblogging service, according to two people with knowledgeof the matter., (Corrects name of Deutsche Telekom CEO to Obermann in fourthparagraph, not Olbermann, as earlier sent), * Europe holds industry conference to debate broadband,LONDON British intelligence eavesdroppers are suffering a steady loss of Internet experts to the private sector because the likes of Google and Microsoft offer much higher wages, a group of lawmakers said on Wednesday.,NEW YORK Electronic Arts Inc, the video game publisher, is buying PopCap Games in a deal worth up to $1.3 billion as it tries to ramp up its social and casual games portfolio and better compete with Zynga Inc.,BANGALORE Shares of Glu Mobile Inc, which makes games for tablets and smartphones, jumped about 13 percent to a near four-year high, a day after Electronic Arts Inc bought Glu Mobile's peer PopCap Games for $1.3 billion.

Title: Analysis: Google antitrust watchers: Place your bets, please
Body: SAN FRANCISCO The antitrust probe into Google Inc  could hem in its growth ambitions for years, even if regulators do not unleash their most formidable weapons: Seeking a breakup of the Internet giant or exerting control over its cherished search algorithm.

Body: NEW YORK Stocks fell on Thursday as Fed Chairman Ben Bernanke backed off hints additional near-term stimulus could be on the way, removing a possible catalyst from a market already facing plenty of obstacles. |Â , * JPMorgan shares rise after bank beats profit forecasts,SAN FRANCISCO Groupon Inc, the largest online daily deals company, has added 11 new underwriters for its upcoming initial public offering.,SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc's results soundly trounced Wall Street's most bullish expectations, sending its shares up 12 percent and easing concerns that its battle with Facebook and Twitter is costing too much and hindering growth. |Â ,NEW YORK Google Inc's second quarter net income rose a better-than-expected 36 percent, as stronger sales softened the impact of rising costs at the Internet giant., * Company says to ignore co-founder's profit comment (Adds comparison to Google IPO, details on new risk warning), * Emerging products can generate huge business - Page (Adds details from call), (Corrects year of Sept. 11 attacks to '2001' in paragraph 14;error first appeared in UPDATE 6), SAN FRANCISCO, July 14 Google Inc's profit grew roughly 36 percent in the second quarter, even asspending at the Internet search leader continued to rise., * JPMorgan shares rise after bank beats profit forecasts

Body: SAN FRANCISCO Blockbuster sales of the iPhone and strong Asian business again helped Apple Inc crush Wall Street's expectations, driving its shares up more than 7 percent to record highs. |Â , * Apple sees incredible opportunities in China (Adds details on net income),NEW YORK Apple Inc shares are rallying in after-market activity following its strong earnings report and are poised to break $400 on Wednesday, which would be an all-time high for the stock. |Â ,SAN FRANCISCO Yahoo Inc's net revenue declined slightly in the second quarter on weakness in its display advertising business, and shares of the Internet search company dropped 2 percent in after-hours trading., * Stock down 2 pct in after-hours trade (Adds CFO comments, analyst EPS expectations), * FDA proposes oversight for small number of complex apps (Adds industry group reaction, details on consumer apps), NEW YORK, July 19  Isis, a venture of three ofthe top four U.S. mobile providers, plans to launch mobilepayments services with major payment networks Visa ,MasterCard , Discover  and American Express ,the venture said on Tuesday.,BANGALORE InterDigital Inc  said its board is evaluating strategic alternatives, including a possible sale of the company or of its patents, a few weeks after a consortium of technology giants picked up Nortel Networks' patents for $4.5 billion.,NEW YORK Isis, a venture of three of the top four U.S. mobile providers, plans to launch mobile payments services with the major payments networks Visa, MasterCard, Discover and American Express.,NEW YORK A Manhattan federal judge set a September 15 deadline for Google Inc, authors and publishers to come up with a legal plan to create the world's largest digital library, expressing frustration that the six-year-old dispute has not been resolved.

Title: Social networking may be in a bubble - Barron's
Body: NEW YORK, July 24 The social-network industryis growing quickly but the stock values of many publicly tradedcompanies in the sector may be increasing faster and face beingovervalued, financial magazine Barron's wrote.

Body: Google Inc said the Department of Justice has asked for more information regarding its acquisition of online advertising company AdMeld., July 27 Google Inc  said the U.S.Department of Justice has asked for more information regardingits acquisition of online advertising company AdMeld.,FAIRFIELD, Connecticut If you want to know why tax from surging corporate profits isn't making much of a dent in the United States' crippling budget deficit, a glance at Microsoft Corp's recent results provides some clues., WASHINGTON, July 27 U.S. Senate Majority LeaderHarry Reid urged Republican leaders on Wednesday to resume workon a massive cybersecurity bill aimed at combating breaches andtheft from U.S. companies and government networks, andRepublicans agreed., * Company says it channels earnings through low-tax havens,NEW YORK, July 27 (IFR) - A U.S. sovereign downgrade is likely to drive down yields on U.S. investment grade corporate bonds, as wary investors snap up these cash-rich credits and the government deals with its own messy balance sheet.,NEW YORK The operator of the Nasdaq Stock Market is "under constant attack" from would-be hackers and will spend more on security as a result, its top executive said., NEW YORK, July 27 (IFR) - A US sovereign downgrade islikely to drive down yields on US investment grade corporatebonds, as wary investors snap up these cash-rich credits andthe government deals with its own messy balance sheet., SAN FRANCISCO, July 27 Texas is the heavyweightchamp among states in luring businesses and it's likely to keepthe title by treating California like a punching bag.,JOHANNESBURG France Telecom's Orange mobile unit is teaming up with Google to offer SMS-based chat in Africa, Orange said in a statement on Wednesday, targeting the fast growth of wireless services on a continent where computers remain scarce.

Body: NEW YORK A U.S. government request that Galleon Group hedge fund founder Raj Rajaratnam spend as much as 24-1/2 years in prison -- a term associated more with murder than financial crimes -- raises the ante in the biggest individual insider trading case in a generation., * Galleon Group founder seeks shorter term, cites health,SEOUL/SAN FRANCISCO A German court has temporarily barred Samsung Electronics from selling its flagship Galaxy tablet in most of the European Union in a significant victory for market leader Apple Inc. |Â ,SEOUL/SAN FRANCISCO A German court has temporarily barred Samsung Electronics from selling its flagship Galaxy tablet in most of the European Union in a significant victory for market leader Apple Inc., * Samsung to launch new Galaxy tablet in Australia in Sept,NEW YORK Shares of Demand Media  soared as much as 20 percent on Wednesday as investors piled back into the company relieved that changes Google  made to its search engine have not affected Demand as badly as feared., SAN FRANCISCO, Aug 10 Groupon Inc'ssecond-quarter loss more than doubled as it hired more than1,000 new employees, even though the Internet daily dealscompany trimmed back its marketing costs., SAN FRANCISCO, Aug 10 Groupon Inc'ssecond-quarter loss more than doubled as it hired more than1,000 new employees, even though the Internet daily dealscompany trimmed back its marketing costs.,SEOUL/SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc scored its most significant victory in its intellectual property battle against Samsung Electronics after a German court temporarily barred the Korean firm from selling its flagship Galaxy tablet in most of the European Union.,NEW DELHI Samsung Electronics, which has been locked in a patent infringement battle with Apple Inc, on Wednesday said a German court order to temporarily bar its flagship Galaxy tablet in the European Union would not affect its launch plans in Australia and India.

Body: NEW YORK (LPC) - Google Inc's $12.5 billion acquisition of Motorola Mobility Holdings Inc suggests that cash-rich companies may not need to access the syndicated loan markets to pay for multi-billion purchases, sources told Thomson Reuters LPC Tuesday.,NEW YORK The pay-TV industry is nervously watching Google Inc's acquisition of Motorola Mobility -- the largest supplier of set-top boxes to consumers' homes., * Have previously clashed with Google on net neutrality, * To trade on Nasdaq under symbol "TUDO" (Adds details on Tudou's internal controls),WILMINGTON, Delaware A Motorola Mobility Inc shareholder sued its board on Tuesday for breaching their duties by agreeing to sell the company too cheaply and asked that the sale be stopped.,NEW YORK Chinese online video company Tudou Holdings Ltd priced shares in its initial public offering within the expected range on Tuesday, even though investor sentiment toward U.S.-listed Chinese stocks and a market rout had suggested it would be difficult., WILMINGTON, Del., Aug 16 A Motorola MobilityInc  shareholder sued its board on Tuesday for breachingtheir duties by agreeing to sell the company too cheaply andasked that the sale be stopped.,NEW YORK Smartphone maker HTC Corp sued Apple Inc, seeking to halt U.S. imports and sales of Macintosh computers, iPads, iPods, iPhones and other devices because of alleged patent infringements., * Apple says competitors should not steal technology (Adds Apple comment, closing stock price),NEW YORK, Aug 16 (LPC) - Google Inc's $12.5 billion acquisition of Motorola Mobility Holdings Inc suggests that cash-rich companies may not need to access the syndicated loan markets to pay for multi-billion purchases, sources told Thomson Reuters LPC Tuesday.

Body: SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc promoted a Groupon-like daily deals offer on its home page on Wednesday for the first time, a rare instance of the Internet giant using its prized online real estate for advertising., * Google displays daily deal coupon on homepage (Adds Google comment),NEW YORK/BERLIN Sony's hopes of dominating consumer electronics once again with its new tablets suffered a crushing blow on Wednesday from analysts and gadget reviewers whose first impressions were overwhelmingly bad., * Analysts concerned high price will turn off consumers,TORONTO Research In Motion's head of developer relations, Mike Kirkup, has resigned, the latest in a string of departures as the BlackBerry maker seeks to claw back ground lost to Apple and Google.,SAN FRANCISCO Groupon spends millions of dollars enticing new subscribers, but the largest daily deal company wants to slash that cost to zero in less than three years, a big part of its quest for profitability, according to two people familiar with the company., * Plan is to be profitable on CSOI basis by end of 2011 (Adds background on Facebook, Yelp), * Plan is to be profitable on CSOI basis by end of 2011, SAN FRANCISCO, Aug 31 Google Inc  promoted a daily deals offer on the front page of its websiteon Wednesday, a rare instance of the search giant using theprized online real estate for advertising.,NEW YORK/BERLIN Sony Corp  took the wraps off its long-awaited tablets on Wednesday with price tags that could hurt the company's chances to compete for the No. 2 spot in the tablet market.

Title: Investors sanguine as Apple's Jobs steps aside,WRAPUP 5-Investors sanguine as Apple's Jobs steps aside,Pandora Media revenue beats on strong ad sales,UPDATE 3-Pandora Media revenue beats on strong ad sales,Analysis: Little relief seen as U.S. finalizes patent reform,UK government not seeking to close social media in riots,WRAPUP 2-Investors undaunted as Apple's Jobs steps aside,Apple fans pay tribute to "industry icon" Jobs,Newsmaker: Steve Jobs has a different operating system,Q+A: German court hears Samsung/Apple design spat
Body: SAN FRANCISCO/NEW YORK Apple Inc's first day without Steve Jobs as chief executive looked awfully similar to most other days: its share price beat the broader stock market. |Â , * At least 13 brokerages maintain ratings on stock (Adds link to package of Reuters stories),NEW YORK Online radio service Pandora Media Inc reported results that beat expectations on strong advertising sales in its fiscal second quarter., * Adj EPS 2 cents vs loss of 3 cents per share St. view,WASHINGTON Congress is tantalizingly close to passing patent reform that President Barack Obama has hailed as an economic booster, but the legislation is expected to do little to divert money away from patent litigation and toward innovation.,LONDON The government said on Thursday it was not seeking special powers to shut down social networking sites during civil unrest after holding talks with the industry and police on how to stop people plotting violence online., SAN FRANCISCO/LOS ANGELES, Aug 25 Apple Inc began a new era on Thursday without Steve Jobs aschief executive, a momentous shift that surprised investors,but barely dented confidence in the near-term outlook for thestock.,SAN FRANCISCO/SHANGHAI (Reuters)- From San Francisco to Seoul to Sydney, fans of Apple Inc paid tribute to Steve Jobs after he resigned as CEO, calling him an icon for the entire technology industry, not just the company he co-founded.,SAN FRANCISCO Hard to understand, difficult to work with and deemed irreplaceable by many Apple fans and investors, Steve Jobs has made a life defying conventions and expectations.,FRANKFURT A German court will decide on Thursday whether Samsung can sell its latest iPad rival in Germany after an preliminary injunction requested by Apple barred the South Korean company from selling its new Galaxy tablets in Europe's biggest economy earlier this month.

Body: WASHINGTON The United States should move aggressively to use social media such as Twitter and Facebook to promote its agenda in Latin America and help newly wired citizens cement political gains, said a new U.S. report obtained by Reuters.,CUPERTINO, California Apple Inc's newest iPhone left Wall Street and fans wishing for more than a souped-up version of last year's device, igniting a rare storm of criticism and disappointment on the Internet. |Â , * Experts single out voice-powered commands (Adds links, details on features, analyst's comments)),THE ISSUE: The new TV season and watershed events such as the Olympics and the 2012 elections are likely to attract big advertising dollars, focusing investor attention on media and entertainment. Title: Internet companies' growing ambitions spook 51 percent of Americans: Reuters/Ipsos poll
Body: SAN FRANCISCO The personal data gathering abilities of Google, Facebook and other tech companies has sparked growing unease among Americans, with a majority worried that Internet companies are encroaching too much upon their lives, a new poll showed.

Title: Google says self-driving car tests now focused on city driving,Google says self-driving car tests now focused on city driving

Title: RWE eyes bigger role in energy saving business
Body: ESSEN, Germany, April 23 German utility RWE plans to sell more energy saving products, its head ofstrategy said, as it strives to offset some of the losses madeby its power plants across Europe.

Body: SAN JOSE, Calif., April 29 Apple has vastlyexaggerated the importance of its patented iPhone features, aSamsung attorney said on Tuesday as the two companies deliveredclosing arguments to jurors after a month-long trial over mobiletechnology.,April 28 Microsoft Corp said it willincrease its cloud storage offering for business users by40-fold as the world's largest software company makes a case forbusinesses buying an all-in-one product from itself rather thanbuying technology "piecemeal" from multiple sellers.

Title: Activists sue San Francisco over controversial tech bus program
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Activists have sued the city and county of San Francisco over a pilot program giving shuttles run by Google and other private companies access to municipal bus stops, claiming it favors higher-paid technology workers over low-income residents.

Title: Tech companies urge U.S. FCC to scrap 'net neutrality' plan
Body: WASHINGTON More than 100 technology companies, including Google Inc, Facebook Inc, Twitter Inc and Amazon.com Inc, have written to U.S. telecom regulators to oppose a new "net neutrality" plan that would regulate how Internet providers manage Web traffic.

Title: As big ad deal falls apart, firms start thinking small
Body: NEW YORK/LONDON The collapse of the $35 billion merger of New York-based Omnicom with France's Publicis is likely to lead the world's biggest ad agencies to think small as they try to counter the challenge from internet giants like Google.

Title: Google plans to offer Wi-Fi access equipment to businesses -report
Body: May 22 Google Inc plans to offer Wi-Finetwork hardware and software at a discount to small andmedium-sized businesses, tech blog The Information reported onWednesday, citing a confidential document it accessed and aperson who was briefed on the project.

Title: EU's Almunia sees Google antitrust decision after summer break,Major U.S. hedge funds sold 'momentum' Internet names in 1st qtr
Body: ST GALLEN, Switzerland, May 15 EU regulatorsplan to issue a final decision on their competition probe intoGoogle after the summer break, the EU's antitrust chiefsaid, after rivals such as Microsoft complained about how Googledisplays Internet search results.,NEW YORK, May 15 Top hedge funds shed theirstakes in high-profile Internet names such as Netflix Inc and Groupon Inc in the first quarter, movingto peers viewed as more mature and less volatile.

Title: Plaintiff in tech hiring suit asks judge to reject settlement,Plaintiff in tech hiring suit asks judge to reject settlement

Title: Google in quandary over how to uphold EU privacy ruling,Google in quandary over how to uphold EU privacy ruling,Google takes steps to comply with EU's 'right to be forgotten' ruling,UPDATE 3-Google takes steps to comply with EU's "right to be forgotten" ruling,Google makes webform for removal of search results after European ruling
Body: BRUSSELS Google and other internet companies find themselves in a quandary over how to strike a balance between privacy and freedom of information as the top world search engine took a first step towards upholding an EU privacy ruling.,* EU citizens can ask Google to remove links through onlineform,Google has taken the first steps to meet a European ruling that citizens can have objectionable links removed from Internet search results, a ruling that pleased privacy campaigners but raised fears that the right can be abused to hide negative information. |Â ,* EU citizens can ask Google to remove links through onlineform,May 29 Google Inc on Thursday said ithas made a webform for Europeans to request the removal ofresults from its search engine to comply with the recent topEuropean court ruling that subjects have the "right to beforgotten."

Body: * Israeli PM orders ground offensive in Gaza -officialstatement,SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc's chief business officer, one of Chief Executive Officer Larry Page's key lieutenants and the company's main liaison to Wall Street, is leaving the Internet search company, the latest high-ranking executive to depart.,SAN FRANCISCO, July 17 Google Inc's  chief business officer, one of Chief Executive OfficerLarry Page's key lieutenants and the company's main liaison toWall Street, is leaving the Internet search company, the latesthigh-ranking executive to depart.,SAN FRANCISCO, July 17 Google Inc's  revenue increased 22 percent in the second quarter, asthe Internet company saw strong demand for ads on its websites.,SEATTLE, July 17 Microsoft Chief ExecutiveOfficer Satya Nadella kicked off one of the largest layoffs intech history on Thursday, hoping to reshape the aging PCindustry titan into a nimbler rival to Apple and Google, andjolt a culture at the company that is used to protecting itsexisting Windows and Office franchises.,TOKYO, July 17 Nissan Motor Co chiefexecutive Carlos Ghosn said some car makers remain reticentabout working with technology giant Google Inc as itdevelops driverless vehicles for fear of their brands'identities becoming submerged.

Title: Italy gives Google 18 months to change data use practices,Italy gives Google 18 months to change data use practices
Body: MILAN Italy's data protection regulator has given Google 18 months to change the way it treats and stores user data, bringing to an end an investigation that is part of a European drive to reform the internet giant's privacy practices.,MILAN, July 21 Italy's data protection regulatorhas given Google 18 months to change the way it treatsand stores user data, bringing to an end an investigation thatis part of a European drive to reform the internet giant'sprivacy practices.

Body: SAN FRANCISCO/FRANKFURT European Union antitrust regulators are preparing to step up investigations of Google Inc's practices on several fronts and are likely to revise certain terms of a settlement involving its search engine that was proposed earlier this year, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.,SAN FRANCISCO/FRANKFURT, July 22 European Unionantitrust regulators are preparing to step up investigations ofGoogle Inc's practices on several fronts and arelikely to revise certain terms of a settlement involving itssearch engine that was proposed earlier this year, the WallStreet Journal reported on Tuesday.,A federal judge rejected Google Inc's bid to dismiss a privacy lawsuit claiming it commingled user data across different products and disclosed that data to advertisers without permission.,WASHINGTON Google Inc must face a class action lawsuit filed by a U.S. woman whose son had bought online videogame items without her consent, a federal judge ruled late on Monday as he turned down the company's request to dismiss the action.,WASHINGTON, July 22 Google Inc mustface a class action lawsuit filed by a U.S. woman whose son hadbought online videogame items without her consent, a federaljudge ruled late on Monday as he turned down the company'srequest to dismiss the action.,July 22 A federal judge rejected Google Inc's bid to dismiss a privacy lawsuit claiming itcommingled user data across different products and disclosedthat data to advertisers without permission.

Title: Google under fire from regulators on EU privacy ruling,UPDATE 2-Google under fire from regulators on EU privacy ruling,Google under fire from regulators over response to EU privacy ruling
Body: BRUSSELS Google's GOOGL.O handling of "right to be forgotten" requests from European citizens came under fire by regulators after the search engine company restricted the removal of Internet links to European sites only, a person familiar with the matter said.,* Google's handling of removal requests has drawn criticism,* EU watchdogs meet web firms over "right to be forgotten"

Title: Zynga names Google executive to board of directors,UPDATE 1-Zynga names Google executive to board of directors,Zynga names Google executive to board of directors
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Zynga Inc has appointed Regina Dugan, a vice president of engineering at Google, to its board, the online gaming company said on Wednesday.,(Adds details on Dugan's experience and committee positions),SAN FRANCISCO, July 9 Zynga Inc hasappointed Regina Dugan, a vice president of engineering atGoogle, to its board, the online gaming company saidon Wednesday.

Title: European regulators training sights on Google's mobile software,Factbox: Google under European regulatory spotlight,INSIGHT-European regulators training sights on Google's mobile software
Body: BRUSSELS/SAN FRANCISCO European regulators are preparing what could be a stern challenge to Google Inc's   mobile software business in the coming months after a nearly four-year investigation into the company's Web search practices left rivals and European politicians dissatisfied.,Google Inc   faces a variety of challenges from European Commission regulators, in contrast to its experience in the United States where the Internet search company has largely mitigated regulatory threats.,BRUSSELS/SAN FRANCISCO, July 30 Europeanregulators are preparing what could be a stern challenge toGoogle Inc's  mobile software business in thecoming months after a nearly four-year investigation into thecompany's Web search practices left rivals and Europeanpoliticians dissatisfied.

Title: Accused prostitute pleads not guilty in heroin death of Google executive
Body: SANTA CRUZ Calif. An accused prostitute charged with killing a Google executive by injecting him with a fatal dose of heroin on his yacht off the California coast pleaded not guilty on Wednesday and her attorney said she has been unfairly demonized in the case.

Title: Google pulls 'Bomb Gaza' game from app store after backlash
Body: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug 4 A mobile game thatsimulates Israeli attacks on the Gaza Strip and invites users to"drop bombs and avoid killing civilians" has been pulled fromGoogle Inc's app store, a company spokesman said on Monday aftera public backlash.

Title: COLUMN-The dangers of deputizing Google to bust child pornographers,Israel's Perion lowers 2014 outlook, looks to shift to mobile,Hong Kong court rules tycoon can sue Google for defamation,Hong Kong court rules tycoon can sue Google for defamation
Body: (The opinions expressed here are those of the author, acolumnist for Reuters.),JERUSALEM, Aug 6 Israel-based Perion Network posted on Wednesday higher quarterly earnings, butlowered its 2014 outlook after Google dented revenueprospects by unexpectedly altering its browser policy.,BEIJING A Hong Kong court has ruled that a local tycoon can sue Google Inc for defamation because searches for his name on Google suggest adding the word 'triad', Hong Kong's notorious organized crime groups.,BEIJING, Aug 6 A Hong Kong court has ruled thata local tycoon can sue Google Inc for defamationbecause searches for his name on Google suggest adding the word'triad', Hong Kong's notorious organised crime groups.

Title: Google to reward secure websites with better search ranking,Google to reward secure websites with better search ranking

Title: Google, Asian telecoms to build $300 million undersea cable to Japan,Google, Asian telecoms to build $300 mln undersea cable to Japan
Body: Search engine Google Inc and five Asian telecom and communications companies have agreed to invest about $300 million to develop and operate a trans-Pacific cable network connecting the United States to Japan.,Aug 11 Search engine Google Inc andfive Asian telecom and communications companies have agreed toinvest about $300 million to develop and operate a trans-Pacificcable network connecting the United States to Japan.

Title: Samsung buys home-automation startup SmartThings
Body: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug 14 Samsung Electronics Co Ltd will buy SmartThings, a  startup backed by PayPalco-founder Max Levchin that helps connect household devices, oneof its largest U.S.-startup acquisitions to date.

Title: Google buys city-guide app maker JetPac
Body: Aug 15 Google Inc is buying JetPacInc, the startup that designs social travel applicationsdisclosed on its website on Friday, without providing details.

Title: Tech investor gets five towns to join social-health experiment
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Technology investor Esther Dyson thinks she has found the answer to America's growing health concerns, and has enlisted five smaller cities across the country to try and prove it.

Title: Vringo shares dive after court tosses patent claims,PRESS DIGEST- New York Times business news - Aug 15
Body: A U.S. appeals court on Friday rejected patent claims brought by a Vringo Inc subsidiary against several companies including Google, sending Vringo shares plummeting.,Aug 15 The following are the top stories on theNew York Times business pages. Reuters has not verified thesestories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

Title: China targets own operating system to take on likes of Microsoft, Google
Body: SHANGHAI, Aug 24 China could have a newhomegrown operating system by October to take on imported rivalssuch as Microsoft Corp, Google Inc and AppleInc, Xinhua news agency said on Sunday.

Title: Verizon denies it plans to open new app store,UPDATE 1-Verizon denies it plans to open new app store,Verizon in talks to launch new app store -industry website,INDIA PRESS-Google to mentor Indian companies-Times of India
Body: WASHINGTON Verizon Communications Inc denied a report on Wednesday it was in talks with carriers and hardware manufacturers to open a new mobile software store.,WASHINGTON, Aug 20 Verizon Communications Inc denied a report on Wednesday it was in talks withcarriers and hardware manufacturers to open a new mobilesoftware store.,WASHINGTON, Aug 20 Verizon Communications Inc is planning to launch a mobile software store that couldpresent a third alternative in a market long-dominated by AppleInc and Google Inc, according to TheInformation, an industry website.,Note: Reuters has not verified this story and does not vouchfor its accuracy. (Compiled by Aby Jose Koilparambil in Bangalore)

Title: Google wins victory in row with German publishers
Body: FRANKFURT, Aug 22 A German regulator handedGoogle Inc a victory on Friday as it said it would notpursue a complaint brought against the internet search engineoperator by a group of publishers for giving users access totheir news articles.

Title: Marketing push, harsh northern winter spur record Florida tourism,Google considering YouTube, Gmail accounts for kids: reports,Google considering YouTube, Gmail accounts for kids - reports

A record 24 million tourists visited Florida this spring, up 3 percent from 2013, spurred by unusually cold northern weather, a Google program that allows virtual beach tours and aggressive marketing, a state official said on Tuesday.,Google Inc is considering allowing online accounts for children under the age of 13 and give their parents control over how the service is used, according to media reports.,Aug 19 Google Inc is consideringallowing online accounts for children under the age of 13 andgive their parents control over how the service is used,according to media reports.

Title: Google-appointed panel kicks off tour of Europe to debate privacy rights,Google-appointed panel kicks off tour of Europe to debate privacy rights

Body: By Alexei Oreskovic, Julia Fioretti and Alastair Macdonald,(Adds details of probe, context, lawmakers and industrycomments),SAN FRANCISCO The European Parliament is preparing to call for the separation of search engines from other commercial services to ensure a level playing field for the Internet industry, according to a draft motion seen by Reuters on Friday, presenting a threat to leading search engine Google Inc.,SAN FRANCISCO, Nov 21 The European Parliament ispreparing to call for the separation of search engines fromother commercial services to ensure a level playing field forthe Internet industry, according to a draft motion seen byReuters on Friday, presenting a threat to leading search engineGoogle Inc.,SAN FRANCISCO, Nov 21 The European Parliament ispreparing to call for a break-up of Google Inc thatwould separate its search services from its other businesses,the Financial Times on Friday cited a draft motion as saying.

Title: Exclusive: Google aiming to go straight into car with next Android - sources

Title: FBI arrests Colorado man over online threats to kill police
Body: DENVER FBI agents arrested a Colorado man who posted online threats advocating the killing of police officers after investigators received a tip-off about one of the messages from Google, prosecutors said on Tuesday.

Title: Apple, Google settle U.S. poaching lawsuit for $415 mln
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Four Silicon Valley companiesincluding Apple Inc and Google Inc agreed topay $415 million to resolve an antitrust class action lawsuit bytech workers who accused the firms of conspiring to avoidpoaching each other's employees, according to a court filing onThursday.

Body: Google Inc reported higher quarterly revenue and  profit as rising online ad volume offset a hit from the strong dollar, sending the Internet company's shares higher in after-hours trading.,(Adds details on volume, quote, Google, Amazon, Microsoft upafter the bell)    * Nasdaq tops March 10, 2000, high of 5,048.62    * S&P 500 hits intraday record high    * Indexes: Dow up 0.11 pct, S&P up 0.24 pct, Nasdaq up 0.41pct    By Caroline Valetkevitch    April 23 The Nasdaq Composite, the U.S. marketindex most closely associated with technology stocks, closed atan all-time high on Thursday, surpassing a 2000 record set justbefore the dotcom crash.    Its new rec,The Nasdaq's alter ego, the PowerShares QQQ fund, has been the go-to exchange-traded fund for individual investors, pension funds, foreign insurers, sovereign wealth funds, and just about anyone else who has ever had the desire to tap technology sector growth for a quick trade or a long hold.,April 23 Google Inc's first-quarterrevenue jumped 12 percent, helped by an 11 percent increase inad sales.,FRANKFURT If customers of Germany's Harting Group, a maker of industrial plugs and sockets, want bespoke products, they can buy them -- if they're prepared to assemble them from a kit themselves.,FRANKFURT, April 23 If customers of Germany'sHarting Group, a maker of industrial plugs and sockets, wantbespoke products, they can buy them -- if they're prepared toassemble them from a kit themselves.,April 23 It's 10 years to the day since thefirst clip ("Me at the Zoo") was uploaded on YouTube, and theservice - now owned by Google Inc - has dominatedonline video-sharing ever since.

Title: Microsoft opens door to Android, Apple phone apps

Title: Huawei stakes claim in 'Internet of Things' market with new operating system
Body: BEIJING, May 20 China's Huawei Technologies CoLtd, the world's biggest telecommunications equipmentmaker, on Wednesday became the latest tech giant to present itsown take on the 'Internet of Things' (IoT), centred on anoperating system designed to allow household and businessappliances to communicate with each other online.

Title: Russia warns Google, Twitter and Facebook on law violations,Russia warns Google, Twitter and Facebook on law violations
Body: MOSCOW/FRANKFURT Russia's media watchdog has written to Google, Twitter and Facebook warning them against violating Russian Internet laws and a spokesman said on Thursday they risk being blocked if they do not comply with the rules.,MOSCOW/FRANKFURT, May 21 Russia's media watchdoghas written to Google, Twitter and Facebook warning them againstviolating Russian Internet laws and a spokesman said on Thursdaythey risk being blocked if they do not comply with the rules.

Title: Fiat Chrysler CEO approached GM about a merger, was rebuffed -NYT

Title: Exclusive: BlackBerry may put Android system on new device: sources
Body: TORONTO BlackBerry  is considering equipping an upcoming smartphone with Google Inc.'s  Android software for the first time, an acknowledgement that its revamped line of devices has failed to win mass appeal, according to four sources familiar with the matter.

Title: Brazil's Rousseff tops off U.S. tour with Silicon Valley visit,CORRECTED-Brazil's Rousseff tops off U.S. tour with Silicon Valley visit,Google's Waze to start carpooling pilot programme in Israel

Title: Google to remove Confederate flag from Google Shopping, ads,Google to remove Confederate flag from Google Shopping, ads,Getty Images takes Google grievance to EU antitrust regulators,Getty Images takes Google grievance to EU antitrust regulators
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc said on Tuesday it would remove content containing the Confederate flag from its Google Shopping service and ads in the wake of last week's racially motivated mass shooting at a historic black church in South Carolina.,SAN FRANCISCO, June 23 Google Inc saidon Tuesday it would remove content containing the Confederateflag from its Google Shopping service and ads in the wake oflast week's racially motivated mass shooting at a historic blackchurch in South Carolina.,BRUSSELS Getty Images [GETTY.UL] has become the latest company to take its grievances with Google to EU antitrust regulators as it accused the world's most popular Internet search engine of favoring its own images service at the expense of rivals.,BRUSSELS, June 23 Getty Images hasbecome the latest company to take its grievances with Google to EU antitrust regulators as it accused the world'smost popular Internet search engine of favouring its own imagesservice at the expense of rivals.

Title: German car makers in stand-off with Nokia over bid for maps business HERE -sources
Body: FRANKFURT, July 8 Germany's big car makers havereached a stand-off with Nokia in their joint bid tobuy the Finnish company's maps business HERE, while rival offersappear to be unravelling, sources familiar with the processsaid.

Title: Investors hope tech giants repeat Google surge
Body: NEW YORK Google Inc's strong quarterly results, which unleashed a massive surge in its shares on Friday, has investors feeling upbeat heading into next week's tech-heavy slate of earnings reports.

Title: Wall Street ends flat as commodity drop caps gains,Options traders grow more bullish on big tech names,India Morning Call-Global Markets
Body: Wall Street was little changed on Monday, as a better-than-expected start to corporate earnings season boosted investor confidence, but gains were curbed by a drop in commodities.,NEW YORK Trading in a key technology fund's options showed signs of growing bullishness on Monday ahead of earnings reports this week from big names in the sector, including Apple Inc , International Business Machines  and Microsoft Corp .,NEW YORK - A major rally in Google pushed the Nasdaq to asecond straight record high on Friday while weak energy stocksweighed on the Dow and S&P 500.

Title: LG Electronics shares surge on speculation of Google stake buy,LG Electronics shares surge on speculation of Google stake buy
Body: SEOUL Shares of South Korea's LG Electronics Inc  surged in morning trade on Wednesday, rising as much as 14.5 percent at one point on market speculation that Google Inc  will acquire a stake in the consumer electronics maker.,SEOUL, July 22 Shares of South Korea's LGElectronics Inc surged in morning trade onWednesday, rising as much as 14.5 percent at one point on marketspeculation that Google Inc will acquire a stake inthe consumer electronics maker.

Title: Yelp needs help, and buyout may be the answer,Yelp needs help, and buyout may be the answer
Body: Selling itself could be one of the few options left for Yelp Inc , which is struggling to win advertising dollars in an increasingly crowded market that already includes Google Inc , TripAdvisor Inc  and GrubHub Inc .,July 29 Selling itself could be one of the fewoptions left for Yelp Inc, which is struggling to winadvertising dollars in an increasingly crowded market thatalready includes Google Inc, TripAdvisor Inc and GrubHub Inc.

Title: UPDATE 1-Google begins testing self-driving prototype cars in Austin, Texas
Body: DETROIT, July 7 Google Inc has beguntesting its self-driving cars in Austin, Texas, expandingefforts to gather information on how the prototypes interactwith traffic, road conditions and people, the company said earlyTuesday.

Title: U.S. private sector vows to ante up on climate finance

Title: Google Fiber's video subscriber growth surges 79 percent in 2015
Body: Alphabet Inc's much-talked about high-speed internet service, Google Fiber, had 53,000 video subscribers as of December end, up 79 percent from a year earlier, brokerage MoffettNathanson said, citing numbers from the U.S. Copyright Office.

Title: Salesforce still mulls bid for Twitter as shareholders resist -sources,Twitter's shares slump on report that potential bidders lose interest
Body: Oct 10 Salesforce.com Inc is stilldeliberating whether it should make an offer for Twitter Inc in the face of resistance from Salesforce shareholdersover the strategic merits and valuation of such a deal, peoplefamiliar with the matter said on Monday.,Twitter Inc's  shares slumped more than 13 percent in early trading on Monday after a weekend Bloomberg report that top potential bidders, including Salesforce.com Inc ,  had lost interest in making a bid for the company.

Title: Exclusive: Thailand considering tougher tax collection rules for internet, tech firms
Body: BANGKOK/JAKARTA Thailand is studying plans to toughen tax collection rules for internet and technology firms like Alphabet Inc's Google, the head of the Revenue Department told Reuters, as the tax affairs of these firms comes under growing scrutiny in Southeast Asia.

Title: Alphabet's unit discloses Snapchat investment
Body: Nov 4 Alphabet Inc's venture capitalarm CapitalG, earlier known as Google Capital, disclosed aninvestment in Snapchat by adding the social networking firm'slogo to a page on its investment portfolio website.

Body: STOCKHOLM, Nov 7 Swedish firm Tobii on Monday announced plans to raise 450 million crowns ($50million) in a rights issue to invest in technology for virtualreality and smartphones.

Title: Google CEO to meet with EU antitrust chief on Friday,Google CEO to meet with EU antitrust chief on Friday
Body: The chief executive of Alphabet Inc's  Google and the European Union's antitrust chief will meet on Friday, following the U.S. technology group's formal rejection this month of a spate of charges, including blocking rivals in online search advertising.,Nov 16 The chief executive of Alphabet Inc's Google and the European Union's antitrust chief willmeet on Friday, following the U.S. technology group's formalrejection this month of a spate of charges, including blockingrivals in online search advertising.

Title: Google formally rejects EU antitrust charges
Body: BRUSSELS Google  on Thursday formally rejected European Union antitrust charges of unfairly promoting its shopping service and blocking rivals in online search advertising, paving the way for EU regulators to rule next year on these issues and potentially impose hefty fines.

Title: RPT-UPDATE 1-Italy looking at Google proposal to settle tax dispute - source
Body: MILAN, Jan 10 Italy's tax authorities arelooking at a proposal from Alphabet Inc's Google topay between 270 million and 280 million euros ($286-296 million)to settle a tax dispute, a source close to the matter said onTuesday.

Title: U.S. Labor department sues Google for compensation data
Body: The U.S. Department of Labor said on Wednesday it filed a lawsuit against Alphabet Inc's  Google unit seeking access to the company's compensation data and documents as part of a routine compliance evaluation.

Title: Alphabet's hardware growth adds to strength in core ad business,Alphabet posts strong revenue growth, higher taxes hit earnings
Body: Alphabet Inc's  core advertising business remained strong and its smartphone and home-automation products were gaining traction, analysts said a day after the company missed profit expectations, hurt by a higher tax rate.,Google parent Alphabet Inc posted fourth-quarter profit below analysts' estimates on Thursday, hurt by a higher tax rate, but analysts cheered the company's progress in diversifying its business beyond advertising.

Title: UPDATE 5-Uber CEO quits Trump's business advisory group
Body: SAN FRANCISCO/WASHINGTON Feb 2 Uber TechnologiesInc Chief Executive Officer Travis Kalanick quitPresident Donald Trump's business advisory group on Thursdayamid mounting pressure from activists and employees who opposethe administration's immigration policies.

Body: Feb 27 Uber Technologies Inc's seniorvice president of engineering, Amit Singhal, has left thecompany for failing to disclose a sexual harassment allegation,stemming from his tenure at Alphabet Inc's Google,Recode reported, citing sources.

Body: * Alphabet - Google CEO Sundar Pichai's 2016 totalcompensation was $199.7 million versus $100.6 million in 2015-SEC filing,April 28 Shares of Cloudera Inc surgedas much as 24 percent in their stock market debut on Friday, thelatest in a string of technology initial public offerings thisyear, giving the big-data analytics company a market value ofabout $2.3 billion.,Alphabet Inc's non-advertising business, which houses its cloud unit, Pixel smartphones and the Play store, has long been sandwiched between Google's advertising juggernaut and its moonshot ventures that have captured popular imagination.,April 28 Alphabet Inc'snon-advertising business, which houses its cloud unit, Pixelsmartphones and the Play store, has long been sandwiched betweenGoogle's advertising juggernaut and its moonshot ventures thathave captured popular imagination.,April 28 Alphabet Inc'snon-advertising business, which houses its cloud unit, Pixelsmartphones and the Play store, has long been sandwiched betweenGoogle's advertising juggernaut and its moonshot ventures thathave captured popular imagination.,(India Morning Newsletter will not be published on Monday, May 1 as markets areclosed for Maharashtra Din and May Day)        To access the newsletter, click on the link:  http://share.thomsonreuters.com/assets/newsletters/Indiamorning/MNC_IN_04282017.pdf        If you would like to receive this newsletter via email, please register at: https://forms.thomsonreuters.com/india-morning/            FACTORS TO WATCH    9:30 am: Junior Finance Minister Arjun Meghwal at an industry event

Title: Google to pay $334 million to settle Italian tax dispute,UPDATE 1-Google to pay 306 mln euros to settle Italian tax dispute,Spam campaign targets Google users with malicious link
Body: MILAN Alphabet Inc's  Google has agreed to pay 306 million euros ($334 million) to settle a tax dispute with Italy, the company and the country's tax authority said on Thursday.,MILAN, May 4 Alphabet Inc's Google hasagreed to pay 306 million euros ($334 million) to settle a taxdispute with Italy, the company and the country's tax authoritysaid on Thursday.,Alphabet Inc  warned its users to beware of emails from known contacts asking them to click on a link to Google Docs after a large number of people turned to social media to complain that their accounts had been hacked.

Title: UPDATE 3-Spam campaign targets Google users with malicious link,Investors cheer Delphi's bet on electric, connected cars,UPDATE 6-Investors cheer Delphi's bet on electric, connected cars,Google Docs warns customers about spam with malicious links,Italy expects to settle Google tax dispute this week - sources,Italy expects to settle Google tax dispute this week - sources,Italy tax chief says close to deal with Google over tax dispute: paper,Italy tax chief says close to deal with Google over tax dispute-paper
Body: May 3 Alphabet Inc warned its users tobeware of emails from known contacts asking them to click on alink to Google Docs after a large number of people turned tosocial media to complain that their accounts had been hacked.,DETROIT Automotive supplier Delphi Automotive Plc  on Wednesday said it plans to spin off operations tied to internal combustion engines and focus on technology for electrically powered and self-driving vehicles, boosting its share price and highlighting the challenges for legacy auto industry players.,DETROIT, May 3 Automotive supplier DelphiAutomotive Plc on Wednesday said it plans to spin offoperations tied to internal combustion engines and focus ontechnology for electrically powered and self-driving vehicles,boosting its share price and highlighting the challenges forlegacy auto industry players.,May 3 Alphabet Inc said on Wednesdayit was investigating widespread reports about a spam campaign inwhich recipients received emails from known contacts that askedthem to click on a link to review a Google Docs document.,MILAN Italy expects to settle a tax dispute withGoogle's parent company, Alphabet Inc, this week, twosources close to the matter said on Wednesday, as the companyseeks to end hostilities with tax authorities across Europe.,MILAN, May 3 Italy expects to settle a taxdispute with Google's parent company, Alphabet Inc,this week, two sources close to the matter said on Wednesday, asthe company seeks to end hostilities with tax authorities acrossEurope.,MILAN Italy and Alphabet Inc's Google are close to reaching a deal to settle a tax dispute, the head of the Italian tax authority Rossella Orlandi told Italian newspaper La Repubblica.,MILAN, May 3 Italy and Alphabet Inc'sGoogle are close to reaching a deal to settle a tax dispute, thehead of the Italian tax authority Rossella Orlandi told Italiannewspaper La Repubblica.

Title: Google gets Australian tax office demand to pay more, says to fight it,Google gets Australian tax office demand to pay more, says to fight it
Body: SYDNEY Alphabet Inc's  Google said it will challenge amended tax assessments issued by the Australian Taxation Office (ATO), which is trying to claw back billions of dollars from multinational corporations citing unpaid taxes.,SYDNEY, April 29 Alphabet Inc's Googlesaid it will challenge amended tax assessments issued by theAustralian Taxation Office (ATO), which is trying to claw backbillions of dollars from multinational corporations citingunpaid taxes.

Body: * Third Point LLC takes share stake of 2.5 million shares inAlcoa Corp

Title: UPDATE 3-Google shifts mobile focus to apps and digital assistant
Body: May 17 Mobile phone apps took center stage atGoogleâ€™s annual developer conference on Wednesday as the searchgiant announced new features for its digital assistant and itspopular photo app while devoting little time to the Androidmobile operating system.

Title: Wall St chat service Symphony raises $63 mln; valued at $1 bln-source
Body: NEW YORK, May 16 Symphony Communication ServicesLLC, the maker of a Wall Street online chat service, said onTuesday it has raised $63 million in new funding led by Frenchbank BNP Paribas SA.

Title: EU to conclude Google antitrust cases in next few months,EU to conclude Google antitrust cases in next few months,EU to conclude Google antitrust cases in next few months
Body: OXFORD EU antitrust regulators will rule in the"next few months" whether Alphabet's Google abused its dominanceof internet searches and other areas, a senior EuropeanCommission official said on Monday, an outcome that could leadto a hefty fine.,OXFORD, England EU antitrust regulators will rule in the "next few months" whether Alphabet's Google abused its dominance of internet searches and other areas, a senior European Commission official said on Monday, an outcome that could lead to a hefty fine.,OXFORD, England, May 22 EU antitrust regulatorswill rule in the "next few months" whether Alphabet's Googleabused its dominance of internet searches and other areas, asenior European Commission official said on Monday, an outcomethat could lead to a hefty fine.

Title: Acquisitions accelerate as tech giants seek to build AI smarts
Body: SAN FRANCISCO, May 26 A total of 34 artificialintelligence startups were acquired in the first quarter of thisyear, more than twice the amount of activity in the year-agoquarter, according to the research firm CB Insights.

Title: Exclusive: Google faces hefty EU fine in shopping case by August - sources
Body: BRUSSELS EU antitrust regulators aim to slap a hefty fine on Alphabet  unit Google over its shopping service before the summer break in August, two people familiar with the matter said, setting the stage for two other cases involving the U.S. company.

Title: SoftBank to buy robotics businesses from Alphabet Inc,UPDATE 3-SoftBank to buy robotics businesses from Alphabet Inc,SoftBank unit agrees to buy Boston Dynamics from Alphabet Inc,BRIEF-SoftBank announces agreement to acquire Boston Dynamics
Body: TOKYO SoftBank Group Corp  said it would buy two firms that build walking robots from Google's parent company, Alphabet Inc , adding to the Japanese company's growing artificial intelligence portfolio.,* Boston Dynamics, Schaft produce walking robots(Adds source comment on assets),June 8 SoftBank Group Corp said onThursday that a subsidiary of the company had agreed to buyrobotics firm Boston Dynamics from Alphabet Inc.,* Entered into a definitive agreement to acquire roboticspioneer Boston Dynamics from Alphabet Inc

Title: Uber fires self-driving car chief at center of court case
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Uber Technologies Inc said on Tuesday it fired the technology whiz it had hired to lead its self-driving unit, Anthony Levandowski, after he failed to comply with a court order to hand over documents at the center of a legal dispute between Uber and Alphabet Inc's  Waymo unit. |Â

Title: Waymo retires Firefly to focus on mass-produced vehicles,Indonesia has reached tax deal with Google for 2016, finance minister  says,Indonesia has reached tax deal with Google for 2016 -finmin
Body: Alphabet Inc's self-driving car unit Waymo said it is retiring its line of Firefly test vehicles to focus on integrating its technology into mass-produced vehicles.,JAKARTA Indonesia has reached a tax settlement with Alphabet Inc's Google for 2016, the country's finance minister said, following a months-long dispute over allegations that the search giant had not made enough annual payments to the government.,JAKARTA, June 13 Indonesia has reached asettlement with Alphabet Inc's Google for 2016 intheir dispute over taxes, the country's finance minister said onTuesday.

Title: Alphabet, Apple analyst research extends tech stock selloff
Body: NEW YORK, June 15 The U.S. technology sectorfell on Thursday, pulled down by heavyweights including AppleInc and Alphabet Inc after bearish analystresearch gave investors a reason to take profits on the stockmarket's recent champion sector.

Title: Uber fires Levandowski amid Waymo self-driving dispute
Body: May 30 Uber Technologies Inc said onTuesday it fired the former head of its self-driving unit,Anthony Levandowski, as he failed to comply with theride-hailing company's internal probe into a dispute withAlphabet Inc's Waymo unit.

Title: Google tightens measures to remove extremist content on YouTube,Google tightens measures to remove extremist content on YouTube
Body: Alphabet Inc's  Google will implement more measures to identify and remove terrorist or violent extremist content on its video sharing platform YouTube, the company said in a blog post on Sunday.,June 18 Alphabet Inc's Google willimplement more measures to identify and remove terrorist orviolent extremist content on its video sharing platform YouTube,the company said in a blog post on Sunday.

Title: Uber CEO Travis Kalanick resigns under investor pressure,UPDATE 9-Uber CEO Travis Kalanick resigns under investor pressure
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Uber Technologies Inc Chief Executive Travis Kalanick, co-founder of one of the most influential technology companies of its generation, resigned on Tuesday under pressure from investors after a string of setbacks. |Â ,SAN FRANCISCO, June 21 Uber Technologies IncChief Executive Travis Kalanick, co-founder of one ofthe most influential technology companies of its generation,resigned on Tuesday under pressure from investors after a stringof setbacks.

Title: Google to stop scanning Gmail for creating targeted ads,Google to stop scanning Gmail for creating targeted ads,London startup Blockchain raises $40 million in fresh funding
Body: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Friday it would stop scanning Gmail content for creating personalized ads from later this year, bringing the widely-used email service in line with its enterprise offering, G Suite.,June 23 Alphabet Inc's Google said onFriday it would stop scanning Gmail content for creatingpersonalized ads from later this year, bringing the widely-usedemail service in line with its enterprise offering, G Suite.,SAN FRANCISCO London-based startup Blockchain has raised $40 million (31.5 million pounds) in a fresh round of funding as the software company rides a wave of enthusiasm for digital currency technology.

Title: Alphabet partners with Avis to manage self-driving car fleet
Body: June 26 Waymo, the self-driving car unit ofAlphabet Inc, signed an agreement with Avis BudgetGroup Inc under which the U.S. car rental firm willmanage its fleet of autonomous vehicles, the companies said onMonday.

Title: Judge rules Uber must disclose key document in Waymo self-driving car case,Judge rules Uber must disclose key document in Waymo self-driving car case,Judge rules Uber must disclose key document in Waymo self-driving car case,UPDATE 1-Lack of power lines hits sub-Saharan Africa's biggest wind farm
Body: SAN FRANCISCO A magistrate judge has ruled thatUber Technologies Inc must hand over a key documentthat could shed light on what its executives knew about allegedtheft of trade secrets from Alphabet Inc's Waymoself-driving car unit.,SAN FRANCISCO A magistrate judge has ruled that Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL] must hand over a key document that could shed light on what its executives knew about alleged theft of trade secrets from Alphabet Inc's  Waymo self-driving car unit.,SAN FRANCISCO, June 7 A magistrate judge hasruled that Uber Technologies Inc must hand over a keydocument that could shed light on what its executives knew aboutalleged theft of trade secrets from Alphabet Inc'sWaymo self-driving car unit.,COPENHAGEN, June 7 The biggest wind farm insub-Saharan Africa is ready for launch but will remain idleuntil next year as Kenya's government has not yet installed thetransmission lines needed to get the clean power to customers,the provider of the turbines said.

Body: * Alphabet Inc on European Commission decision - "Willreview the formal decision, but expects that it will accrue thefine in the second quarter of 2017"â€çâ€‹Source text: http://bit.ly/2ue64IFFurther company coverage:,BRUSSELS EU antitrust regulators hit Google witha record 2.4-billion-euro ($2.7 billion) fine for favouring itsown shopping service, taking a tough line in the first of threeprobes of its dominance in searches and smartphone operatingsystems.,BRUSSELS EU antitrust regulators hit Alphabet  unit Google with a record 2.42-billion-euro ($2.7 billion) fine on Tuesday, taking a tough line in the first of three investigations into the company's dominance in searches and smartphones.,BRUSSELS Alphabet's  Google said on Tuesday it disagreed with the findings of EU antitrust regulators that it had abused its dominant position and was considering an appeal.,BRUSSELS, June 27 EU antitrust regulatorsslapped a record 2.42-billion-euro ($2.7 billion) fine onAlphabet unit Google on Tuesday by illegally favouringits shopping service.

Title: In EU dealings, Google could learn from an erstwhile rival,Google faces years of EU oversight on top of record antitrust fine,REFILE-Google faces years of EU oversight on top of record antitrust fine
Body: BRUSSELS, June 28 (BRUSSELS) - Google's clash withEU antitrust enforcers has echoes of Microsoft'sdecade-long regulatory battle, a legacy that parent companyAlphabet should bear in mind as it considers challenging theCommission, lawyers and fund managers said.,BRUSSELS/FRANKFURT Beyond a headline-grabbing 2.4 billion euro ($2.7 billion) fine EU antitrust regulators have levelled against Google, the internet giant is likely to be shackled for years by Tuesday's precedent-setting decision defining the company as a monopoly.,BRUSSELS/FRANKFURT, June 27 Beyond aheadline-grabbing 2.4 billion euro ($2.7 billion) fine EUantitrust regulators have levelled against Google, the internetgiant is likely to be shackled for years by Tuesday'sprecedent-setting decision defining the company as a monopoly.

Title: China's Baidu taps 50 partners to help advance self-driving,China's Baidu taps 50 partners to help advance self-driving,Google to start getting Norwegian wind power by September
Body: DETROIT Baidu Inc, the top Chinese internet search firm, has formed a broad alliance to promote self-driving cars, pitting its Apollo platform against Alphabet Inc's system, it said on Wednesday, in hopes of getting the vehicles on the road in China by 2019.,DETROIT, July 5 Baidu Inc, the topChinese internet search firm, has formed a broad alliance topromote self-driving cars, pitting its Apollo platform againstAlphabet Inc's system, it said on Wednesday, in hopes of gettingthe vehicles on the road in China by 2019.,OSLO, July 5 Alphabet Inc's Googleunit expects to receive its first wind power from Norway byearly September, the company told Reuters on Wednesday.

Title: Waymo must disclose details of Lyft car deal to Uber -ruling,Facebook to build housing in Silicon Valley for first time,Waymo must disclose details of Lyft car deal to Uber: ruling,Waymo must disclose details of Lyft car deal to Uber -ruling,Google says its service disruption issue resolved,Google says its Drive service facing disruption
Body: SAN FRANCISCO A U.S. judge on Friday ruled thatAlphabet Inc's self-driving car unit Waymo mustdisclose documents to attorneys representing Uber TechnologiesInc about Waymo's partnership with Lyft Inc, sayingthe information could be important in Waymo's lawsuit accusingUber of stealing some of its trade secrets.,SAN FRANCISCO, July 7 The shortage of housing inCalifornia's Silicon Valley has gotten so severe that FacebookInc on Friday proposed taking homebuilding into its ownhands for the first time with a plan to construct 1,500 unitsnear its headquarters.,SAN FRANCISCO A U.S. judge on Friday ruled that Alphabet Inc's self-driving car unit Waymo must disclose documents to attorneys representing Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL] about Waymo's partnership with Lyft Inc, saying the information could be important in Waymo's lawsuit accusing Uber of stealing some of its trade secrets.,SAN FRANCISCO, July 7 A U.S. judge on Fridayruled that Alphabet Inc's self-driving car unit Waymomust disclose documents to attorneys representing UberTechnologies Inc about Waymo's partnership with LyftInc, saying the information could be important in Waymo'slawsuit accusing Uber of stealing some of its trade secrets.,Some of Alphabet Inc's Google services including, Admin Console, Calendar and Hangouts, suffered some service disruption on Thursday but the outages have now been resolved, according to Google service status page.,July 6 Alphabet Inc's Google Driveservice is facing service disruption on Thursday, according toGoogle service status page.

Title: Google Earth to let users post stories, photos in coming years,China could field nearly half of new electric car models by 2020 - study
Body: RIO DE JANEIRO Alphabet Inc  wants users to post millions of stories, video and photos on its Google Earth platform in the next few years, the program chief said on Tuesday at a launch event in Brazil for content focused on showcasing the Amazon rainforest.,DETROIT, July 12 Chinese automakers are on trackto produce 49 of the 103 new electric car models that will belaunched globally by 2020, as part of China's push to acceleratethe switch to battery power from oil, according to a newforecast released on Wednesday.

Title: Alphabet spins out geothermal startup Dandelion,Alphabet spins out geothermal startup Dandelion
Body: Geothermal energy startup Dandelion has left Alphabet Inc's  moonshot accelerator X to become an independent company, Dandelion CEO Kathy Hannun said in a blog post on Thursday.,July 6 Geothermal energy startup Dandelion hasleft Alphabet Inc's moonshot accelerator X to becomean independent company, Dandelion CEO Kathy Hannun said in ablog post on Thursday.

Title: Google redesigns mobile search app with personalized 'feed'
Body: SAN FRANCISCO, July 19 Google on Wednesdayannounced an overhaul of its search app on mobile phones toinclude a personalized feed of links about hobbies, travel,sports and other topics, a move that puts the search companyinto more direct competition with social networks such asFacebook.
